intro: Cryptantha virens, commonly known as the greenflower cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range from green to blue in color. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Cryptantha virens is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of woodlands.
